results.title: Security Is Everybodys Business
results.brief_description: Substance abuse, theft of drugs for re-sale, accidental injury, mugging, kidnapping and theft of records are some of the security and safety problems that occur in hospitals. This video, aimed particularly at health care workers, outlines precautions that may be taken to prevent these occurrences.

results.title: Security and the law
results.creator_credit: Security Films, Jon J. Conrad and Andrew Costikyan
results.brief_description: Security officers undertake tasks similar to police and often present themselves in a similar fashion. However they do not have the legal authority of police. This film presents the American perspective on: security officer operations; differences in the types of crime (as designated by law); arrest procedures; weapons and the use of force; and incident reporting.

results.title: Security
results.creator_credit: Renee Rutgrink and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: They are everywhere, shops, pubs, offices, but we never really notice them. Security guards. Sentinels of public order. Who are they? Cardboard cut-out muscle-men? Or real people? This short documentary about security guards Tunc and Fahim, briefly dips beyond the uniform to reveal their attitudes to both work and life, where they are from and where they are going.

results.title: Secular music of the Renaissance
results.brief_description: David Munroe and the Early English Consort of London present English and Italian secular music of the Renaissance. The instruments, which are introduced before each piece of music, include cornet, sackbut, shawm, crumhorn, cittern, chitarrone and pandora.

results.title: Secrets of the underwater world
results.brief_description: Describes many of the unusual creatures to be found in the shallow seas in the tidal fringe and in fresh water, including the stickleback, diving spider, archer fish, kelpfish, jellyfish, centophere, angler fish, decorator crab, and fiddler crab. Originally released as part of the Disney feature ‘Secrets of life’.

results.title: Secrets of the Titanic
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society, Nicolas Noxon and Robert Ballard
results.brief_description: After years of research and exploration, Dr. Robert Ballard of Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution and a team of researchers located the final resting place of the ill-fated S.S. Titanic, nearly two and one half miles beneath the surface of the icy Atlantic. This is the first photographic expedition to the Titanic after its sinking.

results.title: Secrets of the plant world
results.brief_description: Describes the various ways in which seeds are planted without the help of man. There are seeds which burrow into the ground; some use their own parachutes after being cast afar by a violent explosion of the pod; others twist and gyrate in reaction to sunshine and moisture. Originally released as part of the Disney feature ‘Secrets of life’.

results.title: Secrets of the bee world
results.brief_description: The queen bee is the central figure in the bee world and only she has the power to reproduce the species. The workers build the broad combs in which the honey supply is sealed. Originally released as part of the Disney feature ‘Secrets of life’.
